pre_caption: The video begins with a medium, slightly high-angle shot focused on a green glass champagne bottle standing upright near the center of the frame on a textured, light green blanket, placing the bottle in the middle ground and center of the image. As the bottle tips and falls forward toward the camera, it moves from an upright position in the center to a horizontal position with its neck pointing toward the bottom right, now lying across the middle ground and occupying more of the lower half of the frame. At this moment, Jerry, the cartoon mouse, enters from the top right background, leaping diagonally downward and forward into the middle ground, landing on the left side of the frame. Jerry’s body is positioned in the middle ground, left side, with his arms extended toward the bottle, while the bottle remains in the middle ground, now spanning from the center to the right. The camera remains at a slightly high angle throughout, looking down at both the bottle and Jerry, with the textured blanket filling the foreground and the out-of-focus bedding or fabric elements in the background. The spatial dynamic is defined by the bottle’s movement toward the camera and Jerry’s jump from the upper right background to the left middle ground, resulting in both subjects sharing the middle ground but occupying opposite sides of the frame by the end of the shot.
